fields_of_interest: Trade, Competition, Consumers, Business and Industry, Single market, Research and innovation, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives: Implementation of the recently adopted Regulations on medical devices and in vitro medical devices.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Vigilance Medical Devices Experts Group #E01308#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1308#Member#C#In Vitro Diagnostic Technical Group#E01310#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1310#Member#C#EUROPEAN Unique Device Identification (UDI) COMMISSION EXPERT GROUP#E02896#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2896#Member#C#Medical Devices Experts Group#E01574#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1574#Member#C#IMDRF (International Medical Device Regulators Forum) Working Group#Working Group on European Databank on Medical Devices#E01309#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1309#Member#C#EXPERT GROUP ON NEW & EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES#E03230#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3230#Member#C#Classification and Borderline Expert Group#E01306#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1306#Member#C#Working Group on Clinical Investigation and Evaluation #E01576#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1576#Member#C
relevant_communication:
- Opinions on legislative proposals by the EU communicated to appropriate stakeholders (Commission, Council, EP, Member States, Notified Bodies and other trade associations) 
- Participation in various relevant working groups of the Commission 
- Organisation of conferences
goals__remit: The European Association of Authorised Representatives* (EAAR) was established in 2002 in order to accurately represent organizations that provide European Authorised Representative services to non-European manufacturers of medical devices and in-vitro diagnostic medical devices. Its purpose is also to maintain a dialogue with the European Commission, Competent Authorities, Notified Bodies and other European industry associations about the role of Authorised Representatives in the context of compliance with European medical device regulatory requirements.
